questions.question: What is the main problem that arises due to scarcity in an economy?
Which of the following is a result of scarcity?
What is the term for the study of how people make decisions about how to allocate resources?
Which of the following is an example of a choice that arises due to scarcity?

answers.b: Choosing between a necessity and a luxury

questions.question: What is the opportunity cost of a choice?

answers.c: The alternative that is given up

questions.question: Which of the following is a way to deal with scarcity?
What is the term for the study of how scarcity affects the economy?
Which of the following is a consequence of scarcity?
What is the term for the idea that the economy is always seeking to allocate resources in the most efficient way possible?
Which of the following is an example of how scarcity affects economic decision-making?

answers.a: A company choosing to produce more of a good because it is scarce
answers.b: A consumer choosing to buy a good because it is abundant
answers.c: A government choosing to regulate a market because it is scarce
answers.d: A business choosing to invest in a new technology because it is abundant

questions.question: What are the three basic economic problems that all societies face?

answers.a: What to produce, how to produce, and for whom to produce
answers.b: What to produce, how to produce, and where to produce
answers.c: What to produce, how to produce, and when to produce
answers.d: What to produce, how to produce, and why to produce

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a basic economic problem?

answers.a: What color to paint a house
answers.b: What type of car to buy

questions.question: What is the term for the problem of deciding what goods and services to produce?
Which of the following is a factor that affects the basic economic problems?
What is the term for the problem of deciding how to produce goods and services?
Which of the following is an example of a solution to the basic economic problems?
What is the term for the problem of deciding for whom to produce goods and services?
Which of the following is a consequence of not solving the basic economic problems?
What is the term for the study of how societies solve the basic economic problems?
Which of the following is an example of how the basic economic problems are solved in a market economy?

answers.a: The government makes all the decisions
answers.b: Individuals and businesses make their own decisions
answers.c: The community makes all the decisions

questions.question: What is the term for the idea that the basic economic problems can be solved through individual decision-making?
What is the PPC?
What does the PPC show?

answers.a: The different combinations of two goods that can be produced
answers.b: The different combinations of two goods that cannot be produced
answers.c: The optimal combination of two goods that should be produced
answers.d: The worst combination of two goods that should be produced

questions.question: What is the shape of the PPC?
What does the PPC assume?

answers.c: More than two goods are produced

questions.question: What happens to the PPC when there is technological progress?
What is the PPC also known as?
What does a point inside the PPC represent?
What does a point on the PPC represent?
What is a firm?

answers.a: A business unit that produces goods and services
answers.b: A business unit that only produces goods
answers.c: A business unit that only produces services
answers.d: A business unit that does not produce anything

questions.question: What is the main objective of a firm?
What are the different types of firms?
What is a sole proprietorship?

answers.a: A business owned by one person
answers.b: A business owned by two people
answers.c: A business owned by many people
answers.d: A business owned by the government

questions.question: What is a partnership?

answers.a: A business owned by two or more people
answers.b: A business owned by one person
answers.c: A business owned by many people
answers.d: A business owned by the government

questions.question: What is a corporation?

answers.a: A business owned by many people
answers.b: A business owned by one person
answers.c: A business owned by two people
answers.d: A business owned by the government

questions.question: What is the main advantage of a sole proprietorship?
What is the main disadvantage of a partnership?
What is utility?

answers.a: The want-satisfying power of a good or service
answers.b: The price of a good or service
answers.c: The quantity of a good or service
answers.d: The quality of a good or service

questions.question: What is total utility?

answers.a: The total satisfaction derived from consuming a good or service
answers.b: The total cost of producing a good or service
answers.c: The total revenue from selling a good or service
answers.d: The total profit from selling a good or service

questions.question: What is marginal utility?

answers.a: The additional satisfaction derived from consuming one more unit of a good or service
answers.b: The total satisfaction derived from consuming a good or service
answers.c: The average satisfaction derived from consuming a good or service
answers.d: The total cost of producing a good or service

questions.question: What is the law of diminishing marginal utility?

answers.a: The law that states that as the consumption of a good or service increases, the marginal utility decreases
answers.b: The law that states that as the consumption of a good or service increases, the marginal utility increases
answers.c: The law that states that as the consumption of a good or service decreases, the marginal utility decreases
answers.d: The law that states that as the consumption of a good or service decreases, the marginal utility increases

questions.question: What is the assumption of rationality in the law of diminishing marginal utility?
What is demand?

answers.a: The quantity of a good or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at a given price
answers.b: The quantity of a good or service that producers are willing and able to supply at a given price
answers.c: The price of a good or service
answers.d: The quality of a good or service

questions.question: What are the determinants of demand?
What is the law of demand?

answers.a: The law that states that as the price of a good or service increases, the quantity demanded decreases
answers.b: The law that states that as the price of a good or service increases, the quantity demanded increases
answers.c: The law that states that as the price of a good or service decreases, the quantity demanded decreases
answers.d: The law that states that as the price of a good or service decreases, the quantity demanded increases

questions.question: What is a demand schedule?

answers.a: A table that shows the quantity of a good or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at different prices
answers.b: A table that shows the quantity of a good or service that producers are willing and able to supply at different prices
answers.c: A graph that shows the quantity of a good or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at different prices
answers.d: A graph that shows the quantity of a good or service that producers are willing and able to supply at different prices

questions.question: What is supply?

answers.a: The quantity of a good or service that producers are willing and able to produce and sell at a given price
answers.b: The quantity of a good or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at a given price
answers.c: The price of a good or service
answers.d: The quality of a good or service

questions.question: What are the determinants of supply?
What is the law of supply?

answers.a: The law that states that as the price of a good or service increases, the quantity supplied increases
answers.b: The law that states that as the price of a good or service increases, the quantity supplied decreases
answers.c: The law that states that as the price of a good or service decreases, the quantity supplied increases
answers.d: The law that states that as the price of a good or service decreases, the quantity supplied decreases

questions.question: What is a supply schedule?

answers.a: A table that shows the quantity of a good or service that producers are willing and able to produce and sell at different prices
answers.b: A table that shows the quantity of a good or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at different prices
answers.c: A graph that shows the quantity of a good or service that producers are willing and able to produce and sell at different prices
answers.d: A graph that shows the quantity of a good or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at different prices

questions.question: dxc
